content.description: Stand start on the crimp at chest height with a foot on a lower one reach for a good jug to start working up the hard stuff get a small sharp crimp with your left go up to another tiny crimp with your left and bump off that to a good full pad crimp get a couple of high feet then use a side pull and rock up to get the top out jug
content.protection:
Pads like 4 of them and spotters would be nice like 2 or 3 of them 1 does do fine it's just a little sketchy 

  Kinda scary landing 

  Also a bit high

content.description:
Do you like awkward, kinda scary top outs? If you do do this route. 

  Sit start left left of the right arete on crimps and move up the grove to a jug. From the jug top out with a heel hook. The top out is the crux so be careful.
content.protection: Pads and spotters, there is a dead tree at the base so be careful if you fall off.
content.location: On the face that faces The Beaver Dam Boulder this route climbs the groove just left of the right arete to a jug.

content.description:
This boulder is a tall boulder with a slightly overhanging face (facing the Beaver Dam Boulder). This will house several desperate hard lines and a few other easier lines.  

  So far the only route that has been sent is Civil Disobedience (V1) but there will be plenty of other good routes to come the rock just needs more cleaning.
